description.narrative: Inhabitants of rural communities in Liberia have limited access to general information such as government announcements in newspapers and publications; voter information; public health, sanitation, agricultural, education awareness campaigns; etc. Communit ies have not organized collection and dissemination of such information. There are no public libraries or resource centers in rural communities, only in district and large rural centers. When information is available, the communities don’t have tructures and traditions to share discuss, secure and make written information available such as a library or information resource center. Public information issues are often not discussed amongst larger population to enlighten those who are not able to read and un derstand the information. Public information is often distributed in such format and language that it is not easily understood by majority. The project aims to increase the access of rural population to information enabling active discussion and participat ion in decision making on development issues affecting their lives. Communities access to general knowledge and information is increased by establishing small community knowledge libraries and by providing targeted information materials. Community discussi on forums on targeted issues are organised and coordinated by the trained community information facilitators. The project is implemented in cooperation with National Adult Education association in Liberia (NAEAL) aiming also to increase its capacity to des ign and produce education and information materials as well as to provide adult education services through developed sustainable open-ended extension for the earlier developed basic adult literacy program. The project will increase NAEAL’s presence in th e community to facilitate any future delivery of adult education and / information dissemination activities eg voter education, WASH campaigns, government and civil society information campaigns. Beneficiaries will be 500 trained community information faci litators and members of the 250 targeted communities in Bomi, Cape Mount, Montserrado, Margibi and Bong Counties.
